title: Deep Learning For GeoLocassting Street Level Imagery
subtitle: 2024-2025 Master's Project

items.text: It turns out that there's enough Pre-trained models floating around that we can skip to the fun stuff. This project creates a psuedo ensemble of Machine Learning Models for GeoLocalization of Street level Imagery at the Multi-Neighbourhood scale.
Existing Models focus on broader scales, this psuedo ensemble of models forms a last hop in a broader GeoLocalization Model

The methodology involves extracting and analysing GeoInformative Features using fine-tuned object detection models to identify geographic indicators, such as signage, crosswalks, and architectural elements. Optical Character Recognition (OCR) is used to extract text, which is then transformed into higher-dimensional embeddings using a pre-trained text embedding model. Colour distributions, indicative of geographic location, are captured using HSV histogram embeddings. Three machine learning models are employed to geolocate an unseen image: K-means clustering, a CNN with Attention, and a Multi-Dense Network with Attention.
Python, Tensorflow, Keras, all that stuff
From a datset of 150,510 images, we achieved accuracy of 1.3km (approx) for a 20km^2 candidate area. The overall project graded as an A through the University of Canterbury
As AI continues to evolve, it is essential to address the ethical implications of its use. Issues such as data privacy, bias in algorithms, and job displacement need to be carefully managed.
Climate change is one of the most pressing challenges facing humanity today. Rising global temperatures, melting ice caps, and extreme weather events are clear signs of the crisis.
Scientists warn that if we do not take immediate action, the consequences could be catastrophic. This includes the loss of biodiversity, food shortages, and displacement of millions of people.
Fact: The last decade was the hottest on record.
Governments, businesses, and individuals all have a role to play in combating climate change. Renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, and reducing carbon footprints are key areas of focus.
